channel.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
channel.description:
Just thought this might be a good idea to make Princess slightly more survivable and help her be a little different from other investigative classes.
_**Will o' Wisp:**_ Tells you if the target attacks anyone tonight. Only detects attacks that count as visiting. **If the victim of the attack is you, the attack will be prevented.**
It's a small buff, but it helps Princess stay alive if they got good intuition or an evil avoided being lynched/was pardoned, but it still has ways for evil to get around it (not to mention the limited charges).

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Yeah that’s the technically correct way to put it, since a barriered Princess would wisp a framed fool as using a social ability.

Flirt reads a specific pre-existing trait from a class. Ability’s do not have types so reading them requires you to assign them. So yes it is more arbitrary than flirt

Arbitrary means based on personal preference rather than logical reasoning. I’m not suggesting we classify abilities according to what I think “feels right” but rather according to the same logic that currently classifies classes. I already posted some examples using Mastermind, Cult Leader, Paladin, and Knight. There’s nothing arbitrary about it. I think I explained my reasoning well.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shrimpy:

Fool’s frame would be Killer so that it benefits the Fool when a Princess wisps him. It would be terribly ironic and unfun for a Fool who gets outed for using an ability called DECIEVE

It would be social but it would also interfere with the ability and make it return killer anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Shrimpy:

It’s not more arbitrary than flirt

Flirt reads a specific pre-existing trait from a class. Ability’s do not have types so reading them requires you to assign them. So yes it is more arbitrary than flirt

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Frame would be a Social ability, not Killer.

Fool’s frame would be Killer so that it benefits the Fool when a Princess wisps him. It would be terribly ironic and unfun for a Fool who gets outed for using an ability called DECIEVE

Or maybe we could just use a less arbitrary ability

It’s not more arbitrary than flirt

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
I would still consider Hide/Self-Care as Support abilities, as they do protect people in one way or another. And Frame would be a Social ability, not Killer. This isn’t just for Fool, but also Scorned

Read full topic

item.description:
Shrimpy:

Hide: ?

Hide could be a new ability type called Defensive, which would cover all protective abilities that work on yourself

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Despite both those objections, this upgraded wisp would still be more useful and interesting than the current one, and would make Princess capable of catching a Mastermind claiming Sheriff or a Cult Leader claiming Paladin (which she cannot do right now).

Mastermind
Convert: Special
Foresight: Investigative

Cult Leader
Convert: Special
Eradicate: Killer

Paladin
Test Faith: Investigative
Smite: Killer (instead of support, so that a Cult Leader caught eradicating could claim he used Smite).

Abilities which don’t have an obvious type could be classified differently than the other ability, for the sake of keeping things interesting. For example Defend is arguably both killer and support, but since Coldsteel is clearly killer we’d call it support.

Knight
Defend: Support
Coldsteel: Killer

It would also be fun to have Fool’s Frame classify as killer!

Fool
Hide: ?
Frame: Killer

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Most classes have 2 Ability’s of the same type. And meny other Ability’s have disputed types.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
The idea is to allow room for deduction and counterplay. An evil cannot choose their class type but they can choose which ability to use in order to deceive a wisp.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Or maybe instead of overcomplicating it you could just make it give the targets exact class type or something at that point.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I think if wisp gave you the exact ability type it would address your concerns. Instead of merely narrowing it down to two.

With this you could wisp a Mastermind using a special ability (convert), proving he isn’t Sheriff. Unless you wisped him on Foresight night (investigative).

If someone claimed Knight and you wisped them using a Killer ability, they would have to claim they used Coldsteel instead of defend.

It’s basically the same as current wisp except better.

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That’s just a worse flirt

Read full topic

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: ShadowKnight
item.description:
That seems more confusing than useful, since you can think that someone is Support but then they turn out to be an entirely different class type altogether.

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
what if wisp were changed to “narrow down the ability type used tonight to two”

e.g. if you wisp a phys and he heals someone, you will be told he used a sup/soc ability
same for knight defend, but if knight CS it will say kill/off ability etc

Read full topic

@Livicus: Fair enough!

item.title: Tiny Buff to Princess Survivability
item.dc:creator: ShadowKnight
item.description:
That might be best as a Neutral Special class? I’ve been discussing with a friend now Neutrals need another Merc/Alch/Inq type (Neutral “Benign” if you will) to counter the “Neuts Out” mentality that encourages to kill all Neutrals just in case (and is often actually effective).

Having a Neutral Special that can perform a wide array of services for BD would definitely help in that regard.

Read full topic
